page.title: 14LOCAL POLITICS ERDINGTON
page.content: Parents fight for school choice. Parents have been complaining that their children have got a different school completely to the one that they wanted. One parent has written to Mr.Crawford at the Education Department to show her disgust and anger. Children who have been forced to go to schools not on their choice forms may show little interest in the subjects at that school. A compaign is being mounted by the families whose children have been given a different school. Part of this problem is that Fairfax School has only taken 150 pupils compared to last year's 210. Because of this the Education Department are trying to cover up by merging Fairfax with John Willmott. The parents are getting together to organise a march to try to get the Education Dept. to change it's mind.
